info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 03 at 8:21AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Madison County in western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 215 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 815 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated ongoing moderate rainfall from showers crossing the region from the northwest. Radar and rain gauges indicated three hour rainfall amounts around two inches, with hourly rainfall rates continuing at one-half to three quarters of an inch at times. Minor flooding is either ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hot Springs, Allenstand, Walnut, Faust and Wolf Ridge. Flooding is most likely along and near Little Laurel Creek, Spillcorn Creek, Shelton Laurel Creek, and West Prong Hickey Fork in northern Madison County. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
